member.name: T:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream
member.summary: Used to transfer a byte range
member.remarks: Will transfer the required ranges to the client. Do note that using multiple ranges means that the response will be sent as multipart/byteranges. You therefore have to set that header.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.#ctor(Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.RangeCollection,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The inner stream which we should transfer a range from. The stream is owned by this class.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: You may not seek in this stream. The ranges are handled internally.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
member.exception: You may not set length for this stream. The ranges are handled internally.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: count;Tried to read more than was configured for the range.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: This stream should only be used to read ranges.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.CanRead
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.
member.returns: true if the stream supports reading; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.CanSeek
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.CanWrite
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.Length
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the length in bytes of the stream.
member.returns: A long value representing the length of the stream in bytes.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.ByteRangeStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the position in the ranges to send
member.returns: The current position within the stream.
member.exception: this stream can only be used to read ranges.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.Range.#ctor(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The range "bytes " should not be included.
member.example:
Last 100 bytes
-100
Specific range
100-199
From index 200 and the rest
200-

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Implementation.Range.Read(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads from the specified stream and puts the content in the specified byte buffer.
member.param: Read the range from this stream.
Buffer to copy stream bytes to.
The offset in the buffer to start writing.
Number of bytes available to write to in the buffer.
member.remarks: The stream must support seeking since this method will move to our range position before start reading. Do note that the move is only made for the first read. Make sure that the position isn't changed until everything have been read in this range.

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: T:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Pipeline.Handlers.BodyDecoder
member.summary: Can decode bodies.

remarks.para: Will not pass on the message until the body have been parsed successfully.

The decoder uses a BufferPool buffer to host the body contents.The decoder will switch to for bodies larger than the bufferSize contructor parameter. This will of course hurt performance but keep the memory usage per request down.

member.name: M:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Pipeline.Handlers.BodyDecoder.#ctor(Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Services.IBodyDecoder,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Buffer size of each buffer in the pool. Read the remarks at
Maximum size of the body in bytes. Larger content will generate a response which will be sent back to the client.

member.param: Used to provide buffers used when decoding the body
Maximum size of the body in bytes. Larger content will generate a response which will be sent back to the client.

member.name: T:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Pipeline.Handlers.HttpErrorHandler
member.summary: Pipeline handler catching unhandled exceptions

remarks.para: The handler uses try/catch around context.SendUpstream which allows it to catch any unhandled exceptions that all upstreams handler after this one throws. It then logs the exception, all request parameters and finally invokes the before sending the response back to the client.
Should typically be placed right after the in the pipeline
You need to implement your own adapter for the to receive all errors.

member.summary: Parser for the HTTP header
member.remarks: Parses everything in the header including the seperator line between the header and body. i.e. The next available byte in the buffer is the first body byte.

member.summary: Will try to parse everything in the buffer

remarks.para: Do note that the parser is for the header only. The event will indicate that there might be body bytes left in the buffer. You have to handle them by yourself.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Services.Authentication.IAuthenticationUser.Username
member.summary: Gets or sets user name used during authentication.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Services.Authentication.IAuthenticationUser.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets unencrypted password.
member.remarks: Password as clear text. You could use instead if your passwords are encrypted in the database.

member.name: P:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Services.Authentication.IAuthenticationUser.HA1
member.summary: Gets or sets HA1 hash.

remarks.para: Digest authentication requires clear text passwords to work. If you do not have that, you can store a HA1 hash in your database (which is part of the Digest authentication process).
A HA1 hash is simply a Md5 encoded string: "UserName:Realm:Password". The quotes should not be included. Realm is the currently requested Host (as in Request.Headers["host"]).
Leave the string as null if you are not using HA1 hashes.

member.name: T:Griffin.Networking.Protocol.Http.Services.BodyDecoders.Mono.HttpMultipart
member.summary:
Stream-based multipart handling.
In this incarnation deals with an HttpInputStream as we are now using IntPtr-based streams instead of byte []. In the future, we will also send uploads above a certain threshold into the disk (to implement limit-less HttpInputFiles).
member.remarks: Taken from HttpRequest in mono (http://www.mono-project.com)
